issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The (eucalyptus)aws-exec-read account is used for accessing objectstorage (S3) from the compute (EC2) service. The admin user in this account has a persistent access key:

{code}
#
#
# euare-accountlist
(eucalyptus)objectstorage	000609352935
eucalyptus	000180996180
(eucalyptus)aws-exec-read	000079380414
(eucalyptus)blockstorage	000174925525
(eucalyptus)cloudformation	000071381309
#
# 
# euare-userlistbypath --as-account '(eucalyptus)aws-exec-read'
arn:aws:iam::000079380414:user/admin
# 
# 
# euare-userlistkeys --as-account '(eucalyptus)aws-exec-read' -u admin
AKIAATME3IKITUDEYCOV
Active
#
#
{code}

The access key does not appear to be used (I have not tested removing the key)
fields.summary: aws-exec-read system account users should not have persistent access keys

comments.body: [~sjones], the user is used for download manifest creation. If we remove this key EC2 can't crate download manifest. I've even added a code to ensure that active key always exist for that user https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/auth/Accounts.java#L354 Let me know if a different approach should be used.

[~vasya], the user accesses S3 using EucaS3ClientFactory#getEucaS3ClientForUser which issues a security token rather than using a persistent credential. If you are aware of any need for a persistent access key credential then please add the details to this issue.

[~sjones], the code does use this call https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/clc/modules/imaging-common/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/imaging/manifest/DownloadManifestFactory.java#L114 but unless user has an active key it was failing to get/sign objects.

The aws-exec-read admin user access key was removed as part of EUCA-10830:

{code}
#
# euare-userlistkeys --as-account '(eucalyptus)aws-exec-read' -u admin
#
#
{code}

[~vasya], please comment if there is a particular verification that should be performed to ensure no regressions.
